bug.author: aldanor
bug.summary: DataFrame demo: table rows clipped vertically
bug.description:
Just trying out the DataFrame demo, and the table is clipped in all browsers (more specifically, the first non-header row doesn't have enough free height to be shown, so there's a vertical scroll bar): In Firefox: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2418513/73223283-8194d480-415d-11ea-9cea-b0e776e90d53.png></denchmark-link>
In Chrome: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2418513/73223294-878ab580-415d-11ea-96e3-eae1c3056ea7.png></denchmark-link>
In Safari: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2418513/73223323-97a29500-415d-11ea-96aa-e8c59d3f47a8.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: If there's more than one row - there's a horizontal scroll bar which covers the row itself and which triggers the appearance of a vertical scrollbar on the right: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2418513/73223436-f700a500-415d-11ea-8722-475082ba1c92.png></denchmark-link>
On which version are you? I cannot repro on 0.53. Can you share some more details? Thanks Matteo
Also cannot repro in 0.55.0. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/aldanor>@aldanor</denchmark-link> if you have any new information about this bug we can reopen it. Closing for now.

similiar issue using streamlit hello select DataFrame Demo Streamlit v0.58.0 Windows 10 Edge <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3461761/80274800-301dc680-8707-11ea-8095-ebcfac1532e2.png></denchmark-link>
no issue using Chromium on Windows <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3461761/80274811-3dd34c00-8707-11ea-9bf0-8c4465fa9ebb.png></denchmark-link>

We have the same issue, Streamlit v0.67.1, both Chrome and Firefox, Windows 10. In Chrome it is less prominent because the scrollbars are thinner (but they should not be there at all). But in Firefox the horizontal scrollbar hides the last row of the dataframe.
